# lat_long_binning.LatLongBinning { #latlonghelper.lat_long_binning.LatLongBinning }

```python
lat_long_binning.LatLongBinning(
    latitude,
    longitude,
    grid_size_latitude=0.01,
    grid_size_longitude=0.01,
)
```

A function that is used to bin latitude and longitude into different groups

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name                | Type   | Description                        | Default    |
|---------------------|--------|------------------------------------|------------|
| latitude            | float  | Latitude in degrees (-90 to 90)    | _required_ |
| longitude           | float  | Longitude in degrees (-180 to 180) | _required_ |
| grid_size_latitude  | float  | Grid size of latitude in degrees   | `0.01`     |
| grid_size_longitude | float  | Grid size of longitude in degrees  | `0.01`     |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                           |
|--------|--------|-------------------------------------------------------|
|        | str    | Identifier of the binned latitudeâ€“longitude grid cell |

## Example {.doc-section .doc-section-example}

>>> LatLongBinning(49.2593, -123.2475)
'49.25_-123.25'
